overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a systematic approach to time-series forecasting focused on identifying patterns in limited data (96 hourly points). The analyst prioritizes seasonality detection, handles data constraints (only 4 days of data, no missing values), and selects a simple averaging method due to the absence of clear trends. The approach is pragmatic but constrained by data limitations, leading to a heuristic solution.
common_data_patterns: No missing values in input data
key_insights: Daily seasonality is the dominant pattern, requiring hourly averaging
Limited data (4 days) prevents robust trend analysis
Simple average of same-hour values across days is optimal for short-term forecasts
Forecast repetition of averaged daily cycles for multi-day horizons
Rounding outputs to match input precision (3 decimal places)
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with strong emphasis on pattern recognition and heuristic adaptation. Balances statistical concepts (seasonality, averaging) with practical constraints, avoiding advanced models due to data limitations.
